thread.title: penalties, miscues cause for concern if not corrected soon | Scout's Take podcast
thread.title_full: LSU penalties, miscues cause for concern if not corrected soon | Scout's Take podcast | NOLA.com

author: Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: penalties, miscues cause for concern if not corrected soon | Scout's Take podcast
text:
Leonard Fournette has run wild over two SEC opponents and a previously undefeated ACC opponent to help lead LSU to a 3-0 start, and Brandon Harris has performed relatively well with his opportunities.
What's not to love, for Tigers fans?
Chris Landry, LandryFootball.com Jerit Roser, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune Well, the penalties , the special teams woes and other miscues may actually be a bigger issue than has met the eye just yet, NFL scout Chris Landry said.
Landry visited with NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune writer Jerit Roser this week to discuss the Tigers' 34-24 victory at Syracuse this past week and Saturday's home game against Eastern Michigan.
The Eagles' visit to Baton Rouge kicks off an October stretch — with subsequent games at South Carolina and against Florida and Western Kentucky — that will prove vital to LSU's long-term success.
Early-season excuses, such as the McNeese State cancellation, are now out the window, Landry said, and the Tigers have to correct their mistakes sooner than later before stumbling against an inferior opponent or, ultimately, the brutal stretch of Alabama, Arkansas, Ole Miss and Texas A&M that awaits in November.
Landry and Roser discuss those and other topics, including Fournette's success, Harris' play thus far and what to watch for from freshman defensive back Donte' Jackson moving forward.
Fans can also follow Landry and his analysis of games nationwide on Twitter ( @LandryFootball ) and his website, LandryFootball.com .
